attributes.action: Ban barbeque's within built up and residential areas in the UK
attributes.background: I find it extremely offensive to have to breath in smoke of any kind bellowing from a neighbors garden.The smell gets into my laundry that I hang outside and also my upholstery/bedding. It stinks my entire home out which also means theres no chance that I can enjoy an evening in my own garden.
attributes.additional_details: I haven't eaten meat for 27 years so I am fully evolved and for that reason barbeque's are extremely offensive to someone like myself and why should I have to put of with this smell in my home?Even if I wasn't a Vegan I would still find smoke bellowing through my home unacceptable.Please help me to ban barbecues within built up and residential areas in the UK

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Make prejudicial, unfactual and opinion/vote swaying news reporting criminal.
attributes.background: UK media is now completely corrupted & has become a weapon of mass destruction in itself. We urgently need revised legislation, to ensure that it is no longer used as a tool to sway public opinion in false or self destructive directions. We need this now for the good of the UK & more so for mankind.
attributes.additional_details: VOTE LEAVE TODAY was the front cover of the Daily Express, on the day of the EU referendum. A newspaper should report news for the benefit of the people. Not sway opinion for its own secret agendas. The first 24 hours after the killings in Nice, BBC and all news outlets kept stating Mohamed Bouhlel had no known terrorist links. Yet in the same breath, kept claiming it to be a war act & terrorist attack. If no links, this reporting is biased & inflammatory. Set laws now to stop the propaganda.

attributes.action: Increase the UK's military response against ISIS
attributes.background: The UK has been a part of a US-led coalition against ISIS for nearly two years. In that time period terrorist attacks around the world and against our allies have increased dramatically. We must increase our military efforts to ensure our safety and the safety of our allies by destroying ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: The death toll from ISIS terrorist attacks was 9 in 2013, increased to 1,020 in 2015 and is currently at 840 in 2016 after the horrific attack in Nice. The numbers of attacks continue to increase and ISIS continue to target some of our greatest allies such as Belgium, France and the United States. We must increase our efforts against ISIS to ensure that we are safe from terrorist attacks and to ensure the freedoms we hold so dear are protected.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to specify menu items that are microwave meals
attributes.background:
I propose that restaurants should be required to inform customers on their menu whether a meal is microwaved or prepared fresh.

A large number of restaurants and pubs regularly include ready meals and microwave meals on their menu but are not required to inform customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Requiring restaurants to state this information would allow customers to make a more informed decision on what they're eating, as many people like myself would rather not include microwave meals in their diet, especially when paying a premium for eating it in a restaurant.

This change would hopefully lead customers to ordering freshly made meals, encouraging restaurants to change their practices and perhaps helping their unskilled staff gain kitchen qualifications to help further their careers.

attributes.action: Provide bursaries for mental health training
attributes.background: Psychotherapy and counselling training is lengthy and expensive. Mental health is crying out for more trained professionals. I would like to see incentivised grants to help attract more people to the profession, and to help those attracted, but without the funds to study.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a teacher shortage. As a result, the Government introduced incentivised bursaries to attract more people to train as teachers. The mental health profession has an even bigger shortage, yet training is both lengthy and very expensive. If we are to help deal with the deficit of appointments and patients on waiting lists, then access to training needs is a necessity.

Please support this important campaign to help provide more professionals in such an underresourced sector.

attributes.action: Fund our NHS with an additional £3billion per annum using former EU finances
attributes.background: Our national health service is wavering under the weight of increased expectations and lack of funding. This petition would like to see that NHS staff are paid and treated fairly, compensated properly for any work related illness and supported through any work related illness as may be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: In addition to this there are an increased number of reports of missing medical records that are needed to claim work related illness compensation. The funds should be drawn from the savings of leaving the EU as suggested by the leave campaign. Such insinuations have been recognised in hindsight as a significant influence on the voting of the British public and many feel that the retraction of that notion is unjust.

attributes.action: stop councils using loose chippings as surface repair
attributes.background: Councils need to stop wasting money on surface chipping and do repairs to the road as it damage's vehicles

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Publish a database registering all the Brexit questions and current answers.
attributes.background: As we move closer to Brexit we must all be positive and engage with Government on all of the questions arising from exit some will be simple others more complex but the both the Nation and the EU must know the current UK position.
attributes.additional_details:
Today the Scottish First Minister demanded action on the position of EU national living in the UK.
Friday 3 questions were raised in the Scottish Parliament. The position on the EU arrest warrant, EU Student studying in the UK and  one other.
But as we progress there will be many questions which will make there way to a Bill that goes before parliament. All we ask is to be kept in the picture

attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to follow the policy of free trade globally
attributes.background: In this new age the UK needs to apply policies that reflect and encourage commerce throughout all nations and islands of the United Kingdom and to encourage this with all nations we trade with. This will show a willingness for free market economics to promote prosperity globally not just the UK.

attributes.action: If the UK is forced to leave the EU, the government should apply to rejoin it.
attributes.background:
On 23rd June the EU referendum returned a small majority in favour of the UK leaving the EU. As of yet it is still unclear whether or not Article 50 will be invoked and we actually have to leave.

Should the UK be forced to leave the EU then the government should begin proceedings to rejoin it.

attributes.action: Reform this country before deciding on enacting Article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Mass migration was seen as many to be a root cause for dissent with the EU, yet some UK firms advertise exclusively in Eastern European countries to take advantage of cheap labour. Change our laws to prevent this. Any building firm that hires migrant workers to employ the same number of apprentices
attributes.additional_details: Also, boost money into the NHS by properly claiming with the E111 system or enforcing health insurance for non-EU visitors.  In the Oct 2013 yougov report, this could save £500million annually. All UK residents must pay taxes for 12months before being eligible for benefits. This will also empower our youth to get off benefits as most migrants are much less likely to claim benefits. If UK firms must pay UK and non-UK people the same salary, there is much less incentive for mass migration

attributes.action: Organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate immigrants living & working in the UK
attributes.background: Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

attributes.action: Give landlords more power to self evict bad tenants who break their contracts
attributes.background: My husband and I are landlords of one property and have had some terrible tenants who either feel it's ok to not pay rent or flout other parts of the contract. We have just had our rental completely trashed and landlord insurance covers a tiny fraction. We are working class people who work hard.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/Bernard.Bernie.Mac/posts/10154331015367160

attributes.action: Seize this opportunity to reform the EU by offering an alternative system.
attributes.background: Across Europe much dissatisfaction is being heard, with membership referenda being called for in many other countries. We have the world's best diplomats. This is an opportunity for us to seize the initiative in constructing a Europe Mk II that  recognises sovereignty but encourages free trade.

attributes.action: Make hate crime an urgent national priority in the wake of the EU referendum.
attributes.background: There is mounting evidence that hate crimes are occurring as a direct result of the EU referendum. This must be dealt with firmly and swiftly by ensuring that every police force is ready and able to address this situation. It is spiralling out of control and many people are fearful.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.standard.co.uk/news/crime/police-probe-racist-signs-distributed-after-brexit-vote-in-eu-referendum-a3281021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/brexit-eu-referendum-racial-racism-abuse-hate-crime-reported-latest-leave-immigration-a7104191.html

attributes.action: Increased court powers and sentences for racially motivated attacks.
attributes.background: In the wake of the referendum, there have been massively increased reports of racially motivated attacks on foreign born nationals and Muslims. We need much tougher sentences to stop this from becoming the norm.

attributes.action: A UK Bill of Rights should be introduced as the country leaves the EU.
attributes.background: With the outcome of the UK Referendum now known, many people are concerned about losing the protection of ECHR. A Bill of Rights to protect and enhance our freedoms is a clear statement of our country's commitment to these principles. It should be introduced to coincide with our exit from the Union.

attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Introduce a Code of Conduct for all political advertising.
attributes.background: Since 1999 party political advertising has been outside any code of conduct and is unregulated. The content of some written and broadcast material from both sides in the recent referendum would breach the Advertising Standards Authority's code of practice if it applied to political parties.
attributes.additional_details:
To maintain freedom of expression we propose the code of conduct be applied to all written material and to broadcasts where there is no immediate ability to challenge a statement.

We petition that all statements made in both written and broadcast material meet the following criteria:
Statements implied as fact should be truthful, evidence based and responsible and not misleading or inflame or incite fear or hatred.   Statements that are based on opinion should be clearly indicated as such.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: I want  to create a law to neuter domestic pets except for registered breeders.
attributes.background: Hundreds and thousands of pet animals are slaughtered as there are not enough homes. I have volunteered in pet rescue for  years and its now  worse as peoples lifestyle and priorities in 21st century have changed. Cruelty and neglect are commonplace. Reduce the numbers humanely stop them being born.
attributes.additional_details: Rescue centres are being swamped with unwanted pets They are turning away animals that vets are having to destroy just because they are no longer wanted or cannot be afforded  A law that all domestic animals are neutered unless bred by legislated breeders could stop the puppy farms, and cruelty and neglect by ignorance and greed of casual breeding, and these innocent creatures of all ages could have loving homes  Check the websites of animal charities to see the levels of neglect and euthanasia

attributes.action: Make it compulsory in England for Air Gun Licensing.
attributes.background: I think it should be made compulsory to stop people going in public places, ie woods and shooting anything that moves.
attributes.additional_details: I have been out with my dog and experienced a youth pointing a gun at my dog. As a license holder myself i believe that any gun, ie air pistol or air rifle you should have to hold a license for as you do with any other gun to stop these type of guns falling into the wrong hands.

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: Dont allow food companies to add air to food packages to make them look bigger.
attributes.background: Food manufacturers are filling food packages with air. This is wrong as we are being tricked to buying food and finding out that in food packaging a small percentage is actual food and a large percentage is filled with air! Food with packaging should have a limit to the amount of air it has.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence that manufacturers are filling food packages with air-

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/foodanddrink/foodnews/shocking-x-ray-images-reveal-how-food-manufacturers-are-cheating-shoppers-by-filling-packages-with-air/ar-AAltXRN?li=AAcVLvg&ocid=spartandhp

attributes.action: Ban Triclosan from UK products
attributes.background: The USA Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has banned hand soaps containing triclosan, after ruling that the antibacterial chemical could contribute to antibiotic resistance. Triclosan and other potentially harmful antibacterial chemicals are widely used  in hand washes, deodorants and toothpastes

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Make the use of automatic renewals for insurance and other services illegal.
attributes.background: Automatic renewals are used extensively in the insurance market. They are not however confined to insurance services, and you may find things such as annual gym memberships and even dating agencies will automatically renew your contract and take money from your account without prior warning.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I've spoken to have incurred bank charges as a result of auto renewal payments being declined due to there being insufficient funds in their accounts. In many instances this is due to those people having no knowledge that a payment was about to be taken without prior warning.
